_comment: Centralized source database. Each source is verified once and referenced by ID across prediction files.

accenture-health-ai-2023.title: Accenture Technology Vision 2023: Healthcare Applications
accenture-health-ai-2023.excerpt: Accenture estimated that 40% of all working hours in healthcare could be supported or augmented by language-based AI.

acemoglu-2023.title: The Simple Macroeconomics of AI
acemoglu-2023.excerpt: AI will increase productivity but impact on jobs more modest than often claimed; estimates ~5% of tasks fully automatable.

acemoglu-johnson-power-progress-2023.title: Power and Progress: Our Thousand-Year Struggle Over Technology and Prosperity
acemoglu-johnson-power-progress-2023.excerpt: Technology does not automatically benefit workers; shared prosperity requires deliberate policy choices. AI could follow historical pattern of concentrating gains among capital owners.

acemoglu-macro-2024.title: The Simple Macroeconomics of AI
acemoglu-macro-2024.excerpt: AI may increase TFP by only 0.53-0.66% over 10 years, with limited job displacement effects.

acemoglu-simple-macro.title: The Simple Macroeconomics of AI
acemoglu-simple-macro.excerpt: AI may increase TFP by only 0.53-0.66% over 10 years; limited net job losses of ~2% as many affected tasks are only partially automated.

adobe-creative-survey-2024.title: Adobe Future of Creativity Survey 2024
adobe-creative-survey-2024.excerpt: 74% of creative professionals report using AI tools. 30% say AI has reduced the scope of work they're hired for.

adp-stanford-young-workers-2025.title: Yes, AI Is Affecting Employment. Here's the Data
adp-stanford-young-workers-2025.excerpt: In jobs with high AI exposure, employment for 22- to 25-year-olds fell 6% between late 2022 and July 2025. Software developers saw a 20% early-career decline. Employment among workers 30 and older grew 6-13%.

aha-ai-revenue-cycle-2025.title: 3 Ways AI Can Improve Revenue-Cycle Management
aha-ai-revenue-cycle-2025.publisher: American Hospital Association (Center for Health Innovation)
aha-ai-revenue-cycle-2025.excerpt: About 46% of hospitals and health systems now use AI in their RCM operations. AI-driven NLP systems automatically assign billing codes, and AI predicts likely denials and their causes.

amazon-8k-2024.title: Amazon deploys its 1 millionth robot in a sign of more job automation
amazon-8k-2024.excerpt: Amazon deployed its 1 millionth robot across over 300 fulfillment centers worldwide. CEO Andy Jassy acknowledged that AI will result in fewer people doing some automated jobs, while new roles in robotics maintenance grew 30% at next-generation sites.

anthropic-ceo-entry-level-2025.title: AI could make half of all entry-level white-collar jobs vanish, Anthropic CEO warns
anthropic-ceo-entry-level-2025.excerpt: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei warned that up to 50% of entry-level office jobs could be substantially impacted by AI within the next 2-3 years.

anthropic-econ-primitives-2026.title: The Anthropic Economic Index: Economic Primitives
anthropic-econ-primitives-2026.excerpt: Computer/mathematical tasks account for ~33% of all Claude.ai conversations and ~50% of API traffic, indicating concentrated AI impact on tech-adjacent roles.

anthropic-econ-primitives-adoption-2026.title: The Anthropic Economic Index: Economic Primitives
anthropic-econ-primitives-adoption-2026.excerpt: 49% of jobs now use AI for at least 25% of their tasks (up from 36% in early 2025); widespread adoption could boost US labor productivity by 1.0-1.8 percentage points annually.

anthropic-econ-primitives-overall-2026.title: The Anthropic Economic Index: Economic Primitives
anthropic-econ-primitives-overall-2026.excerpt: 49% of jobs now use AI for at least 25% of their tasks (up from 36% in early 2025); augmentation (52%) has overtaken automation (45%) as primary use pattern.

anthropic-economic-index-2025.title: The Anthropic Economic Index: Measuring AI's Real-World Impact
anthropic-economic-index-2025.excerpt: Census Bureau rigorous measure finds 9.7% of firms actively using AI, while broader surveys report 78%. Adoption gap driven by definitional differences in what counts as AI use.

anthropic-geographic-2025.title: Uneven geographic and demographic patterns of AI adoption
anthropic-geographic-2025.excerpt: AI usage heavily concentrated by income and geography globally; within US, workforce composition matters more than income for adoption patterns.

anthropic-geographic-adoption-2025.title: Uneven geographic and demographic patterns of AI adoption
anthropic-geographic-adoption-2025.excerpt: Only ~25% of Information sector businesses using AI; ~2.5% in Accommodation/Food — adoption patterns driven more by workforce composition than income.

atlantic-wages-2024.title: AI could be coming for higher-paid workers this time

atlassian-ai-collab-2025.title: Why 96% of Companies Aren't Seeing AI ROI
atlassian-ai-collab-2025.excerpt: Survey of 180 Fortune 100 executives and 12,000 knowledge workers. 96% of organizations not seeing dramatic improvements in efficiency, innovation, or work quality from AI. Costing Fortune 500 ~$98B/year in lost returns. Workers report feeling 33% more productive individually, but organizational metrics flat.

autor-new-frontiers-qje-2024.title: New Frontiers: The Origins and Content of New Work, 1940–2018
autor-new-frontiers-qje-2024.excerpt: Demand-eroding effects of automation innovations have intensified in past four decades. New work creation has shifted from production to high-paid professional occupations.

bick-blandin-deming-nber-2025.title: Is AI Already Replacing Jobs? A Large-Scale Survey
bick-blandin-deming-nber-2025.excerpt: 37.4% of US workers used AI on the job in the past week. Adoption highest among college-educated (52%) and workers earning $100K+ (58%). Survey of 25,000 workers.

bick-blandin-deming-wp-2025.title: The Rapid Adoption of Generative AI
bick-blandin-deming-wp-2025.excerpt: Nationally representative survey of 25,000+ working-age adults finds generative AI adoption reached 55.9% overall and 40.7% at work by November 2025, outpacing PC and internet adoption at comparable points post-launch.

blog-mass-unemployment.title: We're not ready for mass AI unemployment

bls-contingent-2025.title: Contingent and Alternative Employment Arrangements — 2025
bls-contingent-2025.excerpt: Median weekly earnings for freelance writers and designers declined 18% in real terms from 2022-2025.

bls-creative-occupations-2025.title: Occupational Outlook: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media
bls-creative-occupations-2025.excerpt: Graphic designer employment projected to decline 4% through 2033. Technical writers projected flat. New AI-creative hybrid roles growing.

bls-education-2025.title: Occupational Outlook: Education, Training, and Library
bls-education-2025.excerpt: Teacher aide and educational support employment projected to decline 3%. Post-secondary teacher demand flat. Private tutoring category declining.

bls-entry-wages-2025.title: Usual Weekly Earnings — Workers 16-24
bls-entry-wages-2025.excerpt: Real median weekly earnings for workers aged 16-24 in professional services fell 5.2% from 2023 to 2025.

bls-health-admin-2025.title: Occupational Outlook: Healthcare Support and Administrative
bls-health-admin-2025.excerpt: Medical records, billing, and coding specialist employment projected to decline 8% through 2033, the steepest decline among healthcare occupations.

bls-may-2024-wage-data.title: BLS Occupational Employment and Wage Statistics, May 2024
bls-may-2024-wage-data.excerpt: Median annual wage for all occupations: $49,500. AI-exposed administrative and clerical wages grew 1.1% vs. 3.8% for non-AI-exposed occupations.

bls-metro-wages-2025.title: Occupational Employment and Wage Statistics — Metropolitan Areas 2025
bls-metro-wages-2025.excerpt: Computer and mathematical occupations in San Jose-SF-Oakland MSA: $178K median. National median: $108K. Gap up from 48% to 65% since 2022.

bls-programmer-employment-observed.title: BLS Occupational Employment Statistics: Computer Programmers — Observed Decline
bls-programmer-employment-observed.excerpt: Computer programmer employment (routine coding roles) fell ~27.5% in roughly two years following ChatGPT's release — one of the largest two-year drops in any occupation tracked by BLS. Software developer employment remained flat.

bls-programmer-projections-2034.title: BLS Employment Projections: Computer Programmers 2024–2034
bls-programmer-projections-2034.excerpt: BLS projects a further 6% decline in programmer roles through 2034. Computer programmer employment (routine coding roles) fell ~27.5% in roughly two years following ChatGPT's release — one of the largest two-year drops in any occupation tracked by BLS. Software developer employment remained flat.

bls-projections-2025.title: Bureau of Labor Statistics Employment Projections 2024-2034

bls-tech-projections-2026.title: AI impacts in BLS employment projections
bls-tech-projections-2026.publisher: Bureau of Labor Statistics (The Economics Daily)
bls-tech-projections-2026.excerpt: Software developer employment projected to grow 17.9% (2023-2033). Despite AI exposure, this occupation is unlikely to experience employment decline because robust software needs are expected to support continued demand.

bls-tech-vs-nontechmetro-2025.title: BLS Tech vs. Non-Tech Metro Wage Analysis Q3 2025
bls-tech-vs-nontechmetro-2025.excerpt: AI roles median salary $157K in hub metros vs. $49,500 median for all occupations nationally. Geographic premium for AI talent continues to widen.

bofa-erica-ai-2025.title: Bank of America: Erica AI Assistant Surpasses 2 Billion Interactions
bofa-erica-ai-2025.excerpt: BofA's Erica AI assistant surpassed 2 billion client interactions with a 98% resolution rate. Now handles 56% of all customer inquiries without human escalation.

brookings-2024.title: New data show no AI jobs apocalypse — for now
brookings-2024.excerpt: Current employment data do not yet show large-scale AI-driven displacement.

brookings-adaptive-capacity-2026.title: Measuring US workers' capacity to adapt to AI-driven job displacement
brookings-adaptive-capacity-2026.excerpt: Of the 37.1 million workers in the top quartile of AI exposure, 26.5 million are in occupations that also have above-median adaptive capacity. 6.1 million workers (4.2%) face high exposure + low adaptive capacity; 86% are women.

brookings-entry-level-2024.title: To prepare young people for the AI workplace, focus on the fundamentals
brookings-entry-level-2024.excerpt: Whether AI destroys jobs or transforms them, young people still need fundamental supports: skill-building, career navigation, and mentorship.

brookings-metro-ai-2024.title: AI and the Geography of Opportunity
brookings-metro-ai-2024.excerpt: AI adoption is concentrating economic gains in a handful of superstar cities, widening the already large metro-level wage divergence.

brookings-white-collar-2024.title: Which jobs are most exposed to generative AI?
brookings-white-collar-2024.excerpt: High-paid, white-collar occupations in business, finance, and law are among the most exposed to generative AI disruption.

brynjolfsson-bls-productivity-2026.title: US Productivity Growth and AI
brynjolfsson-bls-productivity-2026.excerpt: US productivity grew roughly 2.7% in 2025, nearly double the 1.4% annual average of the past decade — a decoupling of output from labor input that is the hallmark of productivity growth.

brynjolfsson-chandar-chen-2025.title: Canaries in the Coal Mine? Six Facts about the Recent Employment Effects of AI
brynjolfsson-chandar-chen-2025.publisher: Stanford Digital Economy Lab (Brynjolfsson, Chandar, Chen)
brynjolfsson-chandar-chen-2025.excerpt: 13% relative decline in employment for workers ages 22-25 in most AI-exposed occupations. Software developer employment for ages 22-25 down nearly 20% since ChatGPT's launch.

brynjolfsson-chandar-chen-cs-2025.title: Canaries in the Coal Mine? Six Facts about the Recent Employment Effects of AI
brynjolfsson-chandar-chen-cs-2025.excerpt: ~11% decline for early-career customer service workers; declines concentrated in roles where AI automates rather than augments tasks.

brynjolfsson-chandar-chen-entry-2025.title: Canaries in the Coal Mine? Six Facts about the Recent Employment Effects of AI
brynjolfsson-chandar-chen-entry-2025.publisher: Stanford Digital Economy Lab (Brynjolfsson, Chandar, Chen)
brynjolfsson-chandar-chen-entry-2025.excerpt: ADP payroll data shows 13% relative decline in employment for ages 22-25 in most AI-exposed occupations. Effects concentrated in automation roles, not augmentation.

brynjolfsson-li-raymond-qje-2025.title: Generative AI at Work
brynjolfsson-li-raymond-qje-2025.excerpt: AI assistance increases customer service worker productivity by 15% on average. Less experienced workers improve most; AI disseminates best practices from top performers.

brynjolfsson-li-raymond-qje-wages-2025.title: Generative AI at Work
brynjolfsson-li-raymond-qje-wages-2025.excerpt: Access to AI assistance increases worker productivity, as measured by issues resolved per hour, by 15% on average, with substantial heterogeneity across workers.

census-bts-ai-2023.title: Business Trends and Outlook Survey: AI Module Q3 2023
census-bts-ai-2023.excerpt: 3.8% of US firms reported using AI in production. An additional 6.4% were in testing/pilot phase. Adoption highest in information (18%) and professional services (12%).

census-bts-ai-2024.title: Business Trends and Outlook Survey: AI Module Q2 2024
census-bts-ai-2024.excerpt: AI usage among US firms rose to 6.6%, with an additional 9.1% in testing. Information sector at 24%, finance/insurance at 15%.

census-bts-ai-2025.title: Business Trends and Outlook Survey: AI Module Q2 2025
census-bts-ai-2025.excerpt: US firm AI usage in production reached 10.2%, with 14.8% in testing. Large firms (500+ employees) at 28%. Adoption accelerating across all sectors.

challenger-ai-job-cuts-2025.title: 2025 Year-End Challenger Report: AI-Related Job Cuts
challenger-ai-job-cuts-2025.excerpt: 54,694 job cuts cited AI as a reason in 2025, concentrated in tech, finance, and customer service sectors.

challenger-ai-layoffs-2025.title: Challenger Report: 55,000 AI-Attributed Layoffs in 2025
challenger-ai-layoffs-2025.excerpt: Employers cited AI as a direct cause for 55,000 job cuts in 2025, concentrated in customer service, data entry, and back-office operations.

challenger-tech-layoffs-2025.title: 78,000 Tech Jobs Lost to AI in H1 2025
challenger-tech-layoffs-2025.excerpt: 78,000 tech sector job losses attributed to AI in the first half of 2025, with QA testing, junior development, and IT support roles most affected.

chegg-enrollment-decline.title: Chegg Q2 2024 Earnings — ChatGPT Impact on Tutoring Market
chegg-enrollment-decline.excerpt: Chegg subscribers fell 50% from peak as students shifted to ChatGPT. Company laid off 23% of workforce, citing AI as primary competitive threat.

chegg-layoffs-2025.title: Chegg Eliminates 636 Employees in Two Rounds of AI-Driven Layoffs
chegg-layoffs-2025.excerpt: Chegg eliminated 636 employees across two rounds of layoffs (23% in 2024, then additional cuts in early 2025), totaling ~67% of peak workforce. CEO explicitly cited AI as existential threat to homework-help business model.

chen-hbs-displacement-2025.title: Displacement or Complementarity? The Labor Market Impact of Generative AI
chen-hbs-displacement-2025.excerpt: 17% decrease in job postings for occupations in top quartile of automation potential, alongside 22% increase in postings for augmentation-prone occupations.

chen-hbs-overall-2025.title: Displacement or Complementarity? The Labor Market Impact of Generative AI
chen-hbs-overall-2025.excerpt: 17% decrease in job postings for highly automatable occupations, but 22% increase for augmentation-prone ones — net effect depends on occupation mix.

chen-hbs-white-collar-2025.title: Displacement or Complementarity? The Labor Market Impact of Generative AI
chen-hbs-white-collar-2025.excerpt: 24% decrease in AI-exposed skills required in highly automatable jobs, but 15% increase in AI-exposed skills for augmentation-prone professional roles.

chronicle-higher-ed-ai.title: Are You Ready for the AI University?
chronicle-higher-ed-ai.excerpt: Over the next decade AI will decimate faculty ranks; TAs will be first casualties, then non-tenured faculty, then tenured positions via attrition. Predicts significant culling of doctoral programs.

cisco-agentic-cs-2025.title: The Race to an Agentic Future: Customer Service Interactions
cisco-agentic-cs-2025.excerpt: Survey of 7,950 decision-makers: 68% of all CS interactions expected to be handled by agentic AI by 2028. 56% expected within 12 months.

claude-code-github-2026.title: Claude Code GitHub Commits Over Time
claude-code-github-2026.excerpt: Claude Code reached 135K+ daily commits on public GitHub (~4% of all public commits). Growth of 42,896x in 13 months from launch. At current trajectory, projected to reach 20%+ of daily commits by end of 2026.

cms-prior-auth-2024.title: CMS Final Rule on Prior Authorization and AI Automation
cms-prior-auth-2024.excerpt: CMS rules now allow electronic prior auth with AI-assisted review, enabling automation of an estimated 60% of prior authorization workflows.

cognizant-new-work-2026.title: New Work, New World 2026: How AI is Reshaping Work
cognizant-new-work-2026.excerpt: Education task exposure jumped from 11% to 49% — a 4.5x increase driven by multimodal AI, advanced reasoning, and agentic systems. Based on reassessment of 18,000 tasks across 1,000 O*NET occupations.

comptia-it-unemployment-2025.title: CompTIA Tech Jobs Report: IT Unemployment Trends
comptia-it-unemployment-2025.excerpt: IT unemployment rate rose from 3.9% to 5.7% between late 2024 and mid-2025, the highest level since 2021, driven by AI-related restructuring.

cui-microsoft-copilot-2025.title: The Effects of Generative AI on Computing Workers' Productivity
cui-microsoft-copilot-2025.publisher: Microsoft/Accenture (Cui, Demirer, Jaffe, Musolff, Peng, Salz)
cui-microsoft-copilot-2025.excerpt: 26% increase in completed pull requests, 13.55% increase in commits, 38.38% increase in builds — but build success rate fell by 5.53 percentage points.

dallas-fed-entry-level-2026.title: Young workers' employment drops in occupations with high AI exposure
dallas-fed-entry-level-2026.excerpt: Employment share of young workers (20-24) in most AI-exposed occupations fell from 16.4% to 15.5%; decline driven by fewer people transitioning into employment, not layoffs.

dallas-fed-overall-2026.title: Young workers' employment drops in occupations with high AI exposure
dallas-fed-overall-2026.excerpt: If fully translated to unemployment, AI-driven employment declines among young workers would explain only 0.1 percentage point rise in aggregate unemployment.

dallas-fed-young-workers-2026.title: Young workers' employment drops in occupations with high AI exposure
dallas-fed-young-workers-2026.excerpt: Employment share of young workers (20-24) in most AI-exposed occupations fell from 16.4% to 15.5% between November 2022 and September 2025.

del-rio-chanona-ai-jobs-2025.title: AI and jobs: A review of theory, estimates, and evidence
del-rio-chanona-ai-jobs-2025.excerpt: Productivity gains 20-60% in controlled RCTs, 15-30% in field experiments; AI exposure measures converge toward high-wage jobs being most exposed.

del-rio-chanona-entry-2025.title: AI and jobs: A review of theory, estimates, and evidence
del-rio-chanona-entry-2025.excerpt: Novice workers benefit more from LLMs in simple tasks but face declining demand across AI-complementary work; digital trace data show substitution in writing and translation.

del-rio-chanona-freelancer-2025.title: AI and jobs: A review of theory, estimates, and evidence
del-rio-chanona-freelancer-2025.excerpt: Digital trace data show substitution already occurring in writing and translation tasks; declining demand for novice workers across AI-complementary freelance work.

del-rio-chanona-white-collar-2025.title: AI and jobs: A review of theory, estimates, and evidence
del-rio-chanona-white-collar-2025.excerpt: AI exposure measures converge toward high-wage jobs being most exposed; digital trace data show substitution already occurring in writing and translation.

dellacqua-jagged-frontier-2023.title: Navigating the Jagged Technological Frontier: Field Experimental Evidence of the Effects of AI on Knowledge Worker Productivity and Quality
dellacqua-jagged-frontier-2023.excerpt: RCT with 758 BCG consultants: for tasks within AI's capabilities, 12.2% more tasks completed, 25.1% faster, output rated 40% higher quality. For tasks outside AI's frontier, performance was 19pp worse.

deloitte-ai-state-2024.title: State of Generative AI in the Enterprise Q3 2024
deloitte-ai-state-2024.excerpt: 79% of enterprise leaders expect gen AI to transform their industry within 3 years. 42% have gen AI in production, up from 22% a year earlier.

deloitte-health-2025.title: 2025 Global Health Care Outlook — AI and Administrative Efficiency
deloitte-health-2025.excerpt: Health systems deploying AI for revenue cycle management report 30% reduction in administrative FTEs within 18 months.

deloitte-professional-services-2025.title: Strategies for Workforce Evolution
deloitte-professional-services-2025.excerpt: A Deloitte survey reveals how AI and human collaboration can help close talent gaps, speed upskilling, and transfer knowledge as demographic changes reshape the workforce.

demirci-jebo-freelance-2025.title: Winners and Losers of Generative AI: Early Evidence of Shifts in Freelancer Demand
demirci-jebo-freelance-2025.publisher: Journal of Economic Behavior & Organization (Demirci, Jiang, Kartal, Trujillo)
demirci-jebo-freelance-2025.excerpt: Peer-reviewed analysis of 2M job postings: freelance writing postings fell 30.37%, graphic design 18.49%, 3D modeling 15.57% within 8 months of ChatGPT launch. Applications per posting rose 8.57%.

duolingo-ai-first-2025.title: Duolingo Cuts Contractors as AI Replaces Content Creation
duolingo-ai-first-2025.excerpt: Duolingo cut 10%+ of its contractor workforce, explicitly replacing human content creators with AI-generated language exercises. CEO announced 'AI-first' strategy for all content production.

egon-zehnder-cfo-ai-2025.title: AI Revolution: CFOs Forecast a Transformation in Finance Teams
egon-zehnder-cfo-ai-2025.excerpt: 18% of CFOs have already eliminated roles due to AI. Of those, 88% of cuts were in accounting, 38% in FP&A, 33% in treasury. Finance teams are the earliest white-collar AI displacement.

eloundou-openai-2024.title: GPTs are GPTs: An Early Look at the Labor Market Impact Potential of LLMs
eloundou-openai-2024.excerpt: ~80% of the US workforce could have at least 10% of their tasks affected by GPTs. Legal, accounting, and financial analysis are among the highest-exposure occupations.

epi-wages-2025.title: State of Working America: AI and Wage Trends

experian-health-claims-2025.title: State of Claims 2025: AI and Claims Processing
experian-health-claims-2025.excerpt: 67% of providers believe AI can improve claims processing, but only 14% have implemented AI tools. Among adopters, 69% report reduced denials. Survey of 250 providers.

ey-10k-ai-2024.title: EY Global — AI Transformation in Professional Services
ey-10k-ai-2024.excerpt: EY invested $1.4B in AI, reporting that AI-assisted audit procedures now cover 40% of routine testing tasks previously performed by junior staff.

factset-earnings-q1-2023.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q1 2023 — AI Mentions Surge
factset-earnings-q1-2023.excerpt: AI mentions in S&P 500 earnings calls more than doubled to 18%. Companies began discussing AI efficiency gains and workforce implications.

factset-earnings-q1-2024.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q1 2024
factset-earnings-q1-2024.excerpt: 43% mentioned AI-workforce topics. A new record. Companies increasingly cite specific headcount savings from AI deployments.

factset-earnings-q1-2025.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q1 2025
factset-earnings-q1-2025.excerpt: 44% of S&P 500 discussed AI-workforce in Q1 2025, a slight pullback from Q4 2024's record. Discussion maturing: less hype, more specific deployment data.

factset-earnings-q2-2023.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q2 2023 — AI Dominates Calls
factset-earnings-q2-2023.excerpt: 32% of S&P 500 companies now discuss AI on earnings calls. 'AI' mentioned an average of 7 times per call among mentioning companies.

factset-earnings-q2-2024.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q2 2024
factset-earnings-q2-2024.excerpt: Slight dip to 41% as initial AI hype normalizes. Discussion shifting from aspirational to operational — specific ROI figures cited.

factset-earnings-q3-2023.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q3 2023
factset-earnings-q3-2023.excerpt: AI mentions reached 36% of S&P 500 companies. Key themes: 'efficiency gains,' 'headcount optimization,' and 'AI-driven productivity.'

factset-earnings-q3-2024.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q3 2024
factset-earnings-q3-2024.excerpt: 44% of S&P 500 discussed AI-workforce. Key new theme: 'AI-native' hiring replacing traditional roles in tech and professional services.

factset-earnings-q3-2025.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q3 2025 — Record AI Mentions
factset-earnings-q3-2025.excerpt: Record 306 S&P 500 companies (61%) cited AI in Q3 2025 earnings calls — a new 10-year high, surpassing the prior record of 292. 95% of IT and Communications sectors mentioned AI. AI-citing companies outperformed 13.9% vs. 5.7%.

factset-earnings-q4-2022.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q4 2022 — AI Mentions
factset-earnings-q4-2022.excerpt: Only 8% of S&P 500 companies mentioned AI in Q4 2022 calls. Pre-ChatGPT baseline for corporate AI discussion.

factset-earnings-q4-2023.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q4 2023
factset-earnings-q4-2023.excerpt: 40% of S&P 500 companies mentioned AI in context of workforce strategy. 'Year of Efficiency' framing adopted by 12% of companies.

factset-earnings-q4-2024.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q4 2024
factset-earnings-q4-2024.excerpt: Record 48% of S&P 500 companies mentioned AI in workforce context. Average mentions per call reached 11. 'Restructuring' and 'automation' became top co-occurring terms.

fang-ecommerce-chatbots-2025.title: The Impact of AI on E-Commerce: Field Experiments on Customer Service and Product Descriptions
fang-ecommerce-chatbots-2025.excerpt: AI chatbots for customer service increased sales by 16%; AI-generated product descriptions increased sales by 2.05% in field experiments.

fiverr-10k-2024.title: Fiverr Announces Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Results
fiverr-10k-2024.excerpt: Fiverr FY2024 marketplace revenue declined 1.3% YoY to $303.1M. Active buyers fell 10% to 3.6M. AI-related categories showed strong growth while traditional low-complexity gig categories contracted.

fiverr-market-report-2023.title: Fiverr Business Trends Report H2 2023
fiverr-market-report-2023.excerpt: Average order value for writing gigs declined 20%. AI-assisted gig categories (AI art, prompt writing) grew 4x but at lower price points.

forrester-2025.title: AI And Automation Will Take 6% Of US Jobs By 2030

forrester-6pct.title: Forrester: AI And Automation Job Impact Forecast
forrester-6pct.excerpt: AI and automation could account for 6% of total US job losses by 2030, equating to 10.4 million roles. Widespread AI-driven job replacement remains unlikely. AI will augment 20% of jobs rather than eliminate them.

forrester-creative-2025.title: The Impact of Generative AI on Marketing and Creative Roles
forrester-creative-2025.excerpt: By 2028, 20% of marketing content will be generated entirely by AI. Creative teams will shrink 15-25% but output will increase.

forrester-cs-2023.title: The State Of Customer Service Automation

forrester-jobs-2025.title: AI And Automation Will Take 6% Of US Jobs By 2030
forrester-jobs-2025.excerpt: Forrester estimates 6% of US jobs will be lost to AI and automation by 2030, partially offset by new job creation.

fortune-ai-earnings-surge-2026.title: Earnings calls citing 'AI' surge in 2025 as 'uncertainty' mentions fade
fortune-ai-earnings-surge-2026.excerpt: AI was the most-cited topic in S&P 500 earnings calls in 2025. Companies mentioning AI in workforce context outperformed peers by 8.2 percentage points on average.

fortune-altman-2026.title: Sam Altman warns AI could displace significant share of jobs

frank-ai-unemployment-2026.title: AI Exposure and Unemployment Risk
frank-ai-unemployment-2026.excerpt: Unemployment risk in AI-exposed occupations rose beginning early 2022; graduates with AI-exposed curricula have higher first-job pay and shorter job searches post-ChatGPT.

frank-ai-unemployment-overall-2026.title: AI Exposure and Unemployment Risk
frank-ai-unemployment-overall-2026.excerpt: Unemployment risk in AI-exposed occupations rose beginning early 2022; graduates with AI-exposed curricula have higher first-job pay and shorter job searches post-ChatGPT.

ft-ai-salaries-2024.title: AI talent comes at a 30% salary premium
ft-ai-salaries-2024.excerpt: Companies hiring AI talent face a 30% salary premium as demand far outstrips supply, with experts warning that the cost of delayed AI hiring will only increase over time.

ft-gig-economy-squeeze.title: The AI squeeze on gig economy workers

gallup-worker-ai-adoption-2025.title: Gallup Workplace AI Adoption Survey Q4 2025
gallup-worker-ai-adoption-2025.excerpt: 46% of US workers reported using AI tools at work in Q4 2025, up from 33% in Q1 2025. Adoption driven by white-collar professional and technical roles.

gartner-agentic-ai-cs-2025.title: Gartner Predicts Agentic AI Will Resolve 80% of Common Customer Service Issues by 2029
gartner-agentic-ai-cs-2025.excerpt: Agentic AI will autonomously resolve 80% of common customer service issues by 2029. Currently only 1.6% of interactions are fully automated end-to-end.

gartner-ai-layoffs-2025.title: Gartner Top Predictions for IT Organizations 2025
gartner-ai-layoffs-2025.excerpt: Despite widespread AI adoption, less than 1% of enterprise layoffs in 2025 were directly attributed to AI. Most workforce changes are gradual restructuring.

gartner-cs-2023.title: Gartner Predicts Conversational AI Will Reduce Contact Center Agent Labor Costs by $80 Billion in 2026

gartner-cs-2025.title: Gartner: By 2027, 25% of organizations will use chatbots as primary customer service channel

gartner-cs-2026-forecast.title: Gartner Forecasts 20-30% of CS Agents Replaced by GenAI by 2026
gartner-cs-2026-forecast.excerpt: Gartner projects 20-30% of customer service agents will be replaced by generative AI by end of 2026. AI adoption in CS jumped from 46% to 61% in one year.

gartner-edtech-2025.title: Gartner Unveils Top Predictions for IT Organizations and Users in 2025 and Beyond
gartner-edtech-2025.excerpt: Predicts 20% of organizations will use AI to flatten organizational structure by 2026, eliminating more than half of middle management positions. General workforce prediction, not EdTech-specific.

gartner-middle-mgmt-2025.title: Gartner: 50% of Middle Management Positions to Be Eliminated by 2030
gartner-middle-mgmt-2025.excerpt: Gartner projects 50% of middle management positions will be eliminated or restructured as AI handles reporting, coordination, and performance monitoring tasks.

genai-adoption-tracker-2025.title: GenAI Adoption Tracker (Harvard / St. Louis Fed)
genai-adoption-tracker-2025.excerpt: Quarterly dashboard tracking generative AI adoption among U.S. working-age adults. Feb & May 2025 values estimated from tracker chart; all other values from published working paper.

gimbel-yale-ai-labor-2025.title: Evaluating the Impact of AI on the Labor Market: Current State of Affairs
gimbel-yale-ai-labor-2025.publisher: Yale Budget Lab (Gimbel, Kinder, Kendall, Lee)
gimbel-yale-ai-labor-2025.excerpt: No economy-wide employment disruption tied to AI since ChatGPT's debut. Measures of AI exposure show no clear relationship with changes in employment or unemployment.

glassdoor-ai-salaries-2025.title: Conversation starter: are AI jobs booming or overhyped?
glassdoor-ai-salaries-2025.excerpt: AI jobs pay more than similar jobs that do not focus on AI, with a typical premium of 25%. The share of AI jobs among new job listings increased 123% from 2023 to 2024.

goldman-300m.title: The Potentially Large Effects of AI on Economic Growth
goldman-300m.excerpt: Roughly two-thirds of current jobs are exposed to some degree of AI automation; generative AI could substitute up to one-fourth of current work.

goldman-ai-2024.title: The Potentially Large Effects of AI on Economic Growth
goldman-ai-2024.excerpt: AI could expose 300 million full-time jobs globally to automation.

goldman-ai-displacement-risk-2025.title: How Will AI Affect the Global Workforce?
goldman-ai-displacement-risk-2025.excerpt: Only 2.5% of work tasks are currently at risk of direct displacement from AI. Remaining exposure is augmentation-oriented, boosting productivity without eliminating roles.

goldman-ai-workforce-2025.title: How Will AI Affect the Global Workforce?
goldman-ai-workforce-2025.excerpt: Young tech workers (20-30) unemployment risen ~3pp since start of 2025; tech employment share fallen below pre-pandemic trend.

goldman-earnings-ai-analysis.title: S&P 500 Earnings Call AI Analysis: Implications for Employment
goldman-earnings-ai-analysis.excerpt: Companies that mention AI + workforce on calls have average headcount growth 3.2pp lower than non-mentioners. The correlation has strengthened each quarter.

goldman-entry-level-2024.title: Goldman Sachs economist warns Gen Z tech workers are first on the chopping block
goldman-entry-level-2024.excerpt: Unemployment rate for 20- to 30-year-olds in tech rose nearly 3% since early 2024. Entry-level job postings in the US diminished about 35% since January 2023. Goldman Sachs predicts AI will displace about 6-7% of the total workforce.

goldman-mei-ai-labor-2026.title: AI and the US Labor Market: Current Impact and Outlook
goldman-mei-ai-labor-2026.excerpt: AI's labor market impact still small — only 5-10K/month drag on net job growth. Only 2½% of jobs exposed to automation today. Baseline forecast: 6-7% of workers displaced (range 3-14%), lowering annual hiring by 1M jobs and raising unemployment ~½pp. US creates 30M gross new jobs/year; does not anticipate job apocalypse. Impact so far largely confined to tech sector but expects it to grow materially.

goldman-overall-measured-2025.title: How Will AI Affect the Global Workforce?
goldman-overall-measured-2025.excerpt: There is no economically or statistically significant correlation between AI exposure and job growth, unemployment, job finding rates, layoff rates, weekly hours, or average hourly earnings.

goldman-overall-workforce-2025.title: How Will AI Affect the Global Workforce?
goldman-overall-workforce-2025.excerpt: AI could displace 6-7% of the US workforce if widely adopted (range 3-14%). Currently 2.5% of US employment at risk of displacement from current AI use cases; unemployment projected to increase by 0.5pp during transition.

goldman-productivity-2025.title: How Will AI Affect the Global Workforce?
goldman-productivity-2025.excerpt: Generative AI will raise the level of labor productivity in the US and other developed markets by around 15% when fully adopted and incorporated into regular production.

goldman-total-projected-2025.title: How Will AI Affect the Global Workforce?
goldman-total-projected-2025.excerpt: AI could displace 6-7% of the US workforce if widely adopted. We remain skeptical that AI will lead to large employment reductions over the next decade.

goldman-total-workforce-2025.title: How Will AI Affect the Global Workforce?
goldman-total-workforce-2025.excerpt: 2.5% of US employment at risk of displacement from current AI use cases; 60% of current US workers in occupations that didn't exist in 1940.

goldman-wages-2023.title: AI and the US Labor Market

goldman-white-collar-2023.title: The Potentially Large Effects of AI on Economic Growth
goldman-white-collar-2023.excerpt: Two-thirds of US occupations are exposed to some degree of AI automation. Administrative and legal professions face the highest exposure rates at 46%.

google-10k-2024.title: Alphabet Inc. 2024 10-K — Workforce & AI Automation Disclosures
google-10k-2024.excerpt: Alphabet disclosed ongoing workforce restructuring, noting AI tools have reduced need for certain engineering and support roles while increasing demand for AI/ML specialists.

hartley-adoption-survey-2026.title: The Labor Market Effects of Generative Artificial Intelligence
hartley-adoption-survey-2026.publisher: Stanford / World Bank (Hartley, Jolevski, Melo, Moore)
hartley-adoption-survey-2026.excerpt: 35.9% of US workers used generative AI by December 2025. Adoption concentrated among younger, college-educated, higher-earning employees.

hartley-entry-level-2026.title: The Labor Market Effects of Generative Artificial Intelligence
hartley-entry-level-2026.publisher: Stanford / World Bank (Hartley, Jolevski, Melo, Moore)
hartley-entry-level-2026.excerpt: 35.9% of US workers used generative AI by December 2025; adoption concentrated among younger, college-educated workers. Small positive wage effects overall.

hartley-genai-exposure-2026.title: The Labor Market Effects of Generative Artificial Intelligence
hartley-genai-exposure-2026.publisher: Stanford / World Bank (Hartley, Jolevski, Melo, Moore)
hartley-genai-exposure-2026.excerpt: LLM adoption among U.S. workers increased from 30.1% to 38.3% between December 2024 and December 2025. Small effects on wages in exposed occupations; no significant effects on job openings or total jobs.

hartley-genai-labor-2026.title: The Labor Market Effects of Generative Artificial Intelligence
hartley-genai-labor-2026.publisher: Stanford / World Bank (Hartley, Jolevski, Melo, Moore)
hartley-genai-labor-2026.excerpt: 35.9% of US workers used generative AI by December 2025; small positive wage effects, no significant decline in job openings.

hartley-high-skill-2026.title: Labor Market Effects of Generative AI
hartley-high-skill-2026.excerpt: Adoption concentrated among younger, college-educated, higher-earning employees, reinforcing wage premium for AI-complementary skills.

hartley-median-wage-2026.title: Labor Market Effects of Generative AI
hartley-median-wage-2026.excerpt: Small positive wage effects identified for workers in AI-exposed occupations; adoption concentrated among younger, college-educated, higher-earning employees.

harvard-edtech-2024.title: Professor tailored AI tutor to physics course. Engagement doubled.
harvard-edtech-2024.excerpt: Learning gains for students in the AI-tutored group were about double those for the in-class group. Students using the AI tutor reported significantly more engagement and motivation to learn.

harvard-health-policy-2024.title: The Impact of AI on Healthcare Employment
harvard-health-policy-2024.publisher: Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health
harvard-health-policy-2024.excerpt: Healthcare admin roles account for 30% of US healthcare employment. AI could eliminate 1.5-2M of these positions while creating 200-400K new tech-adjacent roles.

hbr-ai-potential-layoffs-2026.title: Companies Are Laying Off Workers Because of AI's Potential, Not Its Performance
hbr-ai-potential-layoffs-2026.excerpt: 95% of generative AI projects have failed to deliver measurable returns (citing MIT). PwC: 56% of CEOs said AI failed to boost revenue or lower costs. Layoffs are anticipatory, not performance-driven.

hbr-ai-workslop-2025.title: AI-Generated 'Workslop' Is Destroying Productivity
hbr-ai-workslop-2025.excerpt: Survey of 1,150 US workers: 40% received AI-generated 'workslop' in the past month; each instance cost ~2 hours to deal with. 18% of AI users admitted sending low-quality AI output. Estimated cost: $186/worker/month or ~$9M/year for a 10,000-person org.

hbr-chatbots-2024.title: How AI is Transforming Customer Service

healthtech-ai-admin-2025.title: AI in Healthcare Administration: A Complete Overview
healthtech-ai-admin-2025.excerpt: Administration comprises 25% of all healthcare costs, making it a key target for automation. Organizations are using AI for documentation, coding, scheduling. Ambient documentation frees up to four hours of clinician time.

himss-medical-coding-ai-2025.title: Reshaping the Healthcare Industry with AI-driven Deep Learning Model in Medical Coding
himss-medical-coding-ai-2025.excerpt: Potential annual savings of $122 billion through AI automation of medical coding; 42% of claim denials stem from coding issues.

hosseini-brookings-creative-2025.title: Is Generative AI a Job Killer? Evidence from the Freelance Market
hosseini-brookings-creative-2025.excerpt: Significant decline in job availability and earnings for freelancers in AI-affected creative occupations; some workers adapted by transitioning to programming.

hosseini-brookings-freelancer-2025.title: Is Generative AI a Job Killer? Evidence from the Freelance Market
hosseini-brookings-freelancer-2025.excerpt: High-skill freelancers disproportionately affected by AI — top performers were impacted most, contradicting conventional wisdom that expertise insulates workers.

hosseini-lichtinger-seniority-2025.title: Seniority-Biased Technological Change: Evidence from AI-Adopting Firms
hosseini-lichtinger-seniority-2025.excerpt: Analysis of 62M U.S. resumes: junior employment declined sharply at AI-adopting firms while senior employment was largely unchanged — described as 'seniority-biased technological change.'

huang-cs-2024.title: Generative AI and Customer Service: Evidence from Customer Support Interactions
huang-cs-2024.excerpt: AI assistance increased worker productivity by 14% on average, with greatest gains for novice and low-skilled workers.

humlum-vestergaard-adoption-2025.title: The Unequal Adoption of ChatGPT Exacerbates Existing Inequalities Among Workers
humlum-vestergaard-adoption-2025.excerpt: Workers see ChatGPT halving working times in about a third of tasks, but employer restrictions and required training hinder adoption.

humlum-vestergaard-chatgpt-2025.title: The Unequal Adoption of ChatGPT Exacerbates Existing Inequalities Among Workers
humlum-vestergaard-chatgpt-2025.excerpt: Half of workers in exposed occupations have used ChatGPT; younger, male, higher-achieving workers lead adoption. Women 16pp less likely to use for work.

humlum-vestergaard-chatgpt-adoption-2025.title: The Unequal Adoption of ChatGPT Exacerbates Existing Inequalities Among Workers
humlum-vestergaard-chatgpt-adoption-2025.excerpt: Half of workers in AI-exposed occupations have used ChatGPT; adoption unequal — women 16pp less likely, employer restrictions hinder broader use.

humlum-vestergaard-denmark-2025.title: The Adoption of ChatGPT
humlum-vestergaard-denmark-2025.excerpt: Study of 11 occupations in Denmark: essentially zero effects on earnings and hours worked; confidence intervals rule out effects larger than 2%. AI adoption linked to ~4% occupational switching.

ibm-10k-2024.title: IBM 2024 10-K — AI Strategy & Workforce Transformation
ibm-10k-2024.excerpt: IBM CEO stated plans to replace ~7,800 back-office roles with AI. Company investing in reskilling remaining workforce for AI-augmented roles.

icle-adoption-2026.title: AI, Productivity, and Labor Markets: A Review of the Empirical Evidence
icle-adoption-2026.excerpt: 35.9% of US workers used generative AI by December 2025; adoption is accelerating but remains unevenly distributed across industries and skill levels.

icle-ai-productivity-2026.title: AI, Productivity, and Labor Markets: A Review of the Empirical Evidence
icle-ai-productivity-2026.excerpt: No measurable change in job openings or aggregate employment in AI-exposed occupations; adjustment happening through task reallocation, not broad displacement.

icle-entry-level-2026.title: AI, Productivity, and Labor Markets: A Review of the Empirical Evidence
icle-entry-level-2026.excerpt: Pressure concentrated in entry-level segments of highly exposed occupations; adjustment happening at the margin through task reallocation.

icle-median-wage-2026.title: AI, Productivity, and Labor Markets: A Review of the Empirical Evidence
icle-median-wage-2026.excerpt: Small but statistically significant positive wage effects found across AI-exposed occupations; 35.9% of US workers used generative AI by December 2025.

ilo-gig-workers-2025.title: World Employment and Social Outlook 2025: Platform Labour
ilo-gig-workers-2025.excerpt: Platform workers in writing, translation, and data labeling report median earnings declines of 15-25% since 2023.

ilo-wages-2023.title: Global Wage Report 2022-23: The impact of inflation and COVID-19 on wages and purchasing power

imf-ai-2024.title: Gen-AI: Artificial Intelligence and the Future of Work
imf-ai-2024.excerpt: Almost 40% of global employment is exposed to AI, with advanced economies more affected.

imf-ai-work-2024.title: Gen-AI: Artificial Intelligence and the Future of Work
imf-ai-work-2024.excerpt: Almost 40% of global employment is exposed to AI; in advanced economies, roughly 60% of workers face some degree of AI impact.

imf-inequality-2024.title: AI Will Transform the Global Economy. Let's Make Sure It Benefits Humanity
imf-inequality-2024.excerpt: In most scenarios, AI will likely worsen overall inequality. Higher-income workers may see disproportionate wage gains.

imf-skill-gaps-ai-2026.title: Bridging Skill Gaps for the Future: New Jobs Creation in the AI Age
imf-skill-gaps-ai-2026.excerpt: Around 40% of global employment is exposed to AI; in advanced economies 60%. Demand for new skills is rising with 10% of jobs in advanced economies requiring at least one new skill.

imf-skill-gaps-entry-2026.title: Bridging Skill Gaps for the Future: New Jobs Creation in the AI Age
imf-skill-gaps-entry-2026.excerpt: Emerging evidence that generative AI adoption is reducing entry-level hiring, especially where tasks are automatable rather than complementary to humans.

imf-skill-gaps-geo-2026.title: Bridging Skill Gaps for the Future: New Jobs Creation in the AI Age
imf-skill-gaps-geo-2026.excerpt: Employment 3.6% lower in AI-vulnerable occupations in regions with high AI-skill demand after 5 years; geographic divergence driven by skill concentration.

imf-skill-gaps-premium-2026.title: Bridging Skill Gaps for the Future: New Jobs Creation in the AI Age
imf-skill-gaps-premium-2026.excerpt: Job postings with 4+ new skills pay up to 15% more (UK) and 8.5% more (US); middle-skill roles being squeezed while high-skill workers gain.

indeed-ai-salaries-2023.title: AI Job Postings and Salary Trends

indeed-cnbc-radical-transform.title: 26% of Jobs Face Radical Transformation from AI, Indeed Finds
indeed-cnbc-radical-transform.excerpt: Indeed analysis finds 26% of jobs face radical transformation from AI. Paralegals face 80% automation risk by 2026. Legal research and contract review most affected.

indeed-cs-postings-2025.title: Customer Service Job Postings Decline 18% YoY
indeed-cs-postings-2025.excerpt: Customer service representative postings declined 18% year-over-year. Remaining postings increasingly require technical skills and AI tool familiarity.

indeed-entry-level-2023.title: Entry-Level Job Market Update — Indeed Hiring Lab
indeed-entry-level-2023.excerpt: Entry-level job postings in AI-exposed fields declined 12% YoY. Starting salaries for junior analysts, associates, and coordinators showed early downward pressure.

indeed-geo-premiums-2024.title: The Geography of AI Jobs — Indeed Hiring Lab
indeed-geo-premiums-2024.excerpt: AI-related roles offer a 38% wage premium in top-10 tech metros vs. national average. Non-AI roles in same metros show only 12% premium.

indeed-graphic-artist-postings-2025.title: Indeed Hiring Lab: Creative & Design Job Postings Tracker
indeed-graphic-artist-postings-2025.excerpt: Computer graphic artist job postings declined 33% from pre-ChatGPT levels. Illustration and copywriting postings down 40%+. AI-creative hybrid roles growing.

indeed-overall-postings-2025.title: Total US Job Postings Trend Analysis — January 2025
indeed-overall-postings-2025.excerpt: Total US job postings are 15% below their February 2022 peak. Categories most exposed to AI (data entry, basic admin, customer service) show steepest declines.

indeed-sw-dev-postings-2025.title: Indeed Hiring Lab: Software Developer Job Postings Tracker
indeed-sw-dev-postings-2025.excerpt: Software developer job postings declined 33% from pre-ChatGPT levels. Overall tech postings down 36%. AI/ML roles the only growing category.

indeed-total-postings-2025.title: US Job Postings Are 15% Below Peak — AI Categories Hit Hardest
indeed-total-postings-2025.excerpt: Data entry (-27%), customer service (-18%), and basic admin (-22%) postings saw steepest declines. AI/ML postings +42% YoY.

indeed-wage-tracker-2025.title: US Wage Tracker — Posted Wage Trends by Occupation
indeed-wage-tracker-2025.excerpt: Posted wages for AI-exposed occupations (admin, data entry, basic accounting) grew 1.2% YoY vs. 4.1% for non-AI-exposed roles, suggesting wage suppression.

indexdev-ai-salary-2026.title: AI Salary Statistics 2026: Global Compensation Trends
indexdev-ai-salary-2026.excerpt: AI/ML engineers median total compensation reached $185K in 2025, with top-tier researchers commanding $500K-$1M+. The premium over general software roles widened to 35%.

jpmorgan-10k-ai-2024.title: JPMorgan Chase 2024 10-K — AI and Workforce
jpmorgan-10k-ai-2024.excerpt: JPMorgan disclosed deploying LLM-based tools across legal, compliance, and research functions, with estimated productivity gains equivalent to 3,000+ full-time roles.

jpmorgan-adoption-2025.title: AI's Impact on Job Growth
jpmorgan-adoption-2025.excerpt: Less than 10% of firms using AI regularly as of mid-2025 (BTOS data); ~20% adoption in professional, scientific, and technical industries.

jpmorgan-ai-job-growth-2025.title: AI's Impact on Job Growth
jpmorgan-ai-job-growth-2025.excerpt: Tech/info/media employment stopped growing at end of 2022, coinciding with ChatGPT release; less than 10% of firms using AI regularly as of mid-2025.

jpmorgan-white-collar-2025.title: AI's Impact on Job Growth
jpmorgan-white-collar-2025.excerpt: Non-routine cognitive job workers now face rising unemployment risk, surpassing non-routine manual workers for the first time.

kinder-brookings-2025.title: New data show no AI jobs apocalypse — for now
kinder-brookings-2025.excerpt: Despite fears of imminent AI jobs apocalypse, the overall labor market shows more continuity than disruption since ChatGPT's launch.

klarna-earnings-2024.title: Klarna AI assistant handles two-thirds of customer service chats in first month
klarna-earnings-2024.excerpt: Klarna's AI assistant handled 2.3 million conversations, doing the equivalent work of 700 full-time agents.

klarna-reversal-2025.title: Klarna Reverses Course on AI-Only Customer Service, Rehires Human Agents
klarna-reversal-2025.excerpt: Klarna reversed its AI-only CS strategy after customer satisfaction dropped 22%. CEO Siemiatkowski: 'we went too far.' Now operates hybrid model with AI handling ~66% but humans for complex cases.

korinek-brynjolfsson-agrawal-acm-2026.title: A Research Agenda for the Economics of Transformative AI
korinek-brynjolfsson-agrawal-acm-2026.publisher: CEPR / Stanford Digital Economy Lab (Brynjolfsson, Korinek, Agrawal)
korinek-brynjolfsson-agrawal-acm-2026.excerpt: As we approach Transformative AI, there is urgent need to advance understanding of how it reshapes economic models, institutions, and policies. Proposes nine Grand Challenges including economic growth, income distribution, and transition dynamics.

korinek-stiglitz-steering-2025.title: Steering Technological Progress
korinek-stiglitz-steering-2025.excerpt: Framework for guiding innovation to increase labor demand; steering technology becomes more desirable the less efficient social safety nets are.

korinek-trammell-growth-2025.title: Economic Growth under Transformative AI
korinek-trammell-growth-2025.publisher: Annual Review of Economics / NBER (Korinek, Trammell)
korinek-trammell-growth-2025.excerpt: Sufficiently advanced AI could dramatically raise growth rates and lower labor share, breaking Kaldor Facts. Wages may rise or fall depending on returns to scale and direction of technical change.

lightcast-2024.title: The AI Talent Landscape: Skills, Demand, and Compensation

lightcast-beyond-buzz-2025.title: Beyond the Buzz: Developing the AI Skills Employers Actually Need
lightcast-beyond-buzz-2025.excerpt: Analysis of 1.3B job postings finds AI skills command 28% salary premium (~$18K/year); 43% for workers with 2+ AI skills. 51% of AI-skill postings now outside IT/CS with 800% growth in non-tech gen AI roles since 2022.

lightcast-geo-wages-2023.title: The Lightcast Global AI Skills Outlook
lightcast-geo-wages-2023.excerpt: AI skills are becoming a universal priority beyond Silicon Valley. The U.S. leads in AI skills demand, with San Francisco commanding the highest average tech salary at $177,636.

lightcast-tech-postings-2025.title: How AI is Disrupting the Tech Job Market: Data from 20M Job Postings
lightcast-tech-postings-2025.excerpt: Job openings grew 80% for AI scientists and 70% for ML engineers, while backend engineer postings declined 14%, frontend 24%, and data engineers 20%+.

linkedin-ai-salary-2025.title: AI reports and resources
linkedin-ai-salary-2025.excerpt: LinkedIn's AI skills resources hub tracking AI engineering talent growth (130% increase since 2016). 7 out of every 1,000 LinkedIn members globally are AI engineering talent.

linkedin-econ-graph-2023.title: Future of Work Report: AI at Work
linkedin-econ-graph-2023.excerpt: 55% of LinkedIn members hold jobs that stand to be impacted by generative AI. By 2030, the skills required for jobs will change by up to 65%.

manning-aguirre-adaptive-2026.title: How Adaptable Are American Workers to AI-Induced Job Displacement?
manning-aguirre-adaptive-2026.excerpt: 6.1 million workers in AI-exposed roles lack adaptive capacity; 86% are women. Vulnerability concentrated in college towns and state capitals in Mountain West and Midwest.

mckinsey-12m-workers-2025.title: Generative AI and the future of work in America
mckinsey-12m-workers-2025.excerpt: An additional 12 million occupational shifts expected by 2030. Workers in lower-wage jobs are up to 14 times more likely to need to change occupations. Activities accounting for up to 30% of hours could be automated.

mckinsey-2023.title: The economic potential of generative AI
mckinsey-2023.excerpt: Generative AI could enable automation of up to 70% of business activities across occupations.

mckinsey-ai-survey-2023.title: The State of AI in 2023: Generative AI's Breakout Year
mckinsey-ai-survey-2023.excerpt: One-third of respondents say their organizations are using gen AI regularly in at least one business function. AI adoption overall at 55% of survey respondents.

mckinsey-ai-survey-2024.title: The State of AI in Early 2024
mckinsey-ai-survey-2024.excerpt: 72% of organizations surveyed now use AI in at least one function, up from 55% the prior year. Generative AI adoption doubled.

mckinsey-ai-survey-2025.title: The State of AI in 2025
mckinsey-ai-survey-2025.excerpt: AI is now a core part of business strategy for 78% of respondents. 65% report measurable revenue or cost impact from AI deployments.

mckinsey-ai-survey-nov-2025.title: The State of AI: Agents, Innovation, and Transformation (Nov 2025)
mckinsey-ai-survey-nov-2025.excerpt: 88% of organizations use AI in ≥1 function (up from 78%). Gen AI adoption at 71%. But only 7% fully scaled, and just 6% report EBIT impact ≥5%. 62% experimenting with AI agents.

mckinsey-creative-automation.title: The economic potential of generative AI — Creative work
mckinsey-creative-automation.excerpt: Generative AI could automate 25-40% of time spent on creative tasks, fundamentally changing the economics of content production.

mckinsey-entry-level-2025.title: Generative AI and the future of work in America
mckinsey-entry-level-2025.excerpt: By 2030, activities accounting for up to 30% of hours currently worked could be automated, accelerated by generative AI. Lower-wage workers face up to 14x more occupational transitions than higher-wage counterparts.

mckinsey-genai-occupations.title: The economic potential of generative AI: The next productivity frontier
mckinsey-genai-occupations.excerpt: Banking, insurance, and capital markets could see up to 50% of current work activities automated. Legal research and contract review are among the most automatable tasks.

mckinsey-gig-2025.title: How is AI affecting freelance jobs?
mckinsey-gig-2025.excerpt: Generative AI is upending freelance work. High-skill freelancers were disproportionately impacted, with top performers seeing the largest setbacks in both contracts and earnings.

mckinsey-health-admin-2023.title: Transforming healthcare: AI's potential to reduce administrative burden
mckinsey-health-admin-2023.excerpt: Up to $265B in annual US healthcare administrative costs could be reduced through simplification of coding, billing, and prior authorization processes.

medium-doom-2025.title: We're not ready for mass AI unemployment

meta-10k-2024.title: Meta Platforms 2024 10-K — AI Efficiency & Headcount
meta-10k-2024.excerpt: Meta's 'Year of Efficiency' resulted in ~21,000 job cuts across 2023. Company cited AI-driven productivity gains enabling smaller teams to maintain output.

metr-2026.title: Uplift Update: Measuring AI's Impact on Open-Source Developer Productivity
metr-2026.excerpt: Updated study: original developers now estimated at -18% speedup (CI: -38% to +9%). Newly-recruited developers estimated at -4% (CI: -15% to +9%). Wide confidence intervals span zero.

microsoft-10k-ai-2024.title: Microsoft 2024 Annual Report
microsoft-10k-ai-2024.excerpt: Over 60,000 Azure AI customers by end of FY2024, growing nearly 60% YoY. Azure AI revenue reached a $13 billion annual run rate, growing 175% YoY.

microsoft-global-ai-2025.title: AI at Work Is Here. Now Comes the Hard Part
microsoft-global-ai-2025.excerpt: 75% of knowledge workers now use AI tools. Adoption in enterprises with 500+ employees reached 60%, up from 40% a year prior.

mit-ai-premium-2025.title: Artificial Intelligence and Jobs: Evidence from Online Vacancies
mit-ai-premium-2025.publisher: Journal of Labor Economics (Acemoglu, Autor, Hazell, Restrepo)
mit-ai-premium-2025.excerpt: AI-exposed establishments reduce hiring in non-AI positions. A wage premium of 11% exists for job postings requiring AI skills within the same firm.

mit-entry-wage-2024.title: Applying AI to Rebuild Middle Class Jobs
mit-entry-wage-2024.excerpt: AI could enable a larger set of workers to perform higher-stakes decision-making tasks currently reserved for elite experts. If used well, AI can help restore the middle-skill, middle-class heart of the US labor market.

mit-task-2024.title: Beyond AI Exposure: Which Tasks are Cost-Effective to Automate with Computer Vision?
mit-task-2024.excerpt: Only 23% of worker wages for vision tasks would be cost-effective to automate with AI today.

moneypenny-regional-ai-2025.title: The State of AI Adoption in U.S. Businesses | 2025 Trends
moneypenny-regional-ai-2025.excerpt: Mountain region leads US AI adoption at 42%, followed by Pacific at 39%. Southeast lags at 22%. Regional adoption gaps correlate with widening wage divergence.

msft-earnings-2024.title: Microsoft FY24 Q3 Press Release
msft-earnings-2024.excerpt: Microsoft Cloud revenue was $35.1 billion, up 23%. More than 65% of the Fortune 500 now use Azure OpenAI Service, and $100M+ Azure deals increased over 80% YoY.

muro-kinder-geography-2025.title: The geography of generative AI's workforce impacts will likely differ from those of previous technologies
muro-kinder-geography-2025.excerpt: 43% of workers in San Jose could see AI shift half or more of tasks, vs only 31% in Las Vegas. High-skill metro areas most exposed — reversing prior automation patterns.

nber-ai-legal-impact-2025.title: The Impact of AI on the Legal Profession: Evidence from ChatGPT
nber-ai-legal-impact-2025.excerpt: AI chatbots had no statistically significant impact on hours worked or wages earned for lawyers. Law graduate employment in 2024 reached 93.4% — the highest rate on record.

nber-ai-wages-2023.title: The Impact of AI on Labor Markets: A Survey
nber-ai-wages-2023.excerpt: Workers who complement AI see significant wage gains; those whose tasks are substituted face wage pressure.

nber-bloom-firm-data-adoption-2026.title: Firm Data on AI
nber-bloom-firm-data-adoption-2026.excerpt: 69% of firms across US, UK, Germany, and Australia currently use some AI technology (US: 78%). LLM text generation most common (41%). Expected to rise to 75% in 3 years. Larger, more productive, higher-paying firms more likely to adopt.

nber-bloom-firm-data-ai-2026.title: Firm Data on AI
nber-bloom-firm-data-ai-2026.excerpt: Survey of ~6,000 executives across US, UK, Germany, Australia. 90%+ report no employment impact from AI over the past 3 years. Firms expect AI to reduce employment by 0.7% over the next 3 years (US: -1.2%). Employees, by contrast, expect +0.5% job creation.

nber-creative-ai-2024.title: Generative AI and Creative Work: Evidence from Freelance Platforms
nber-creative-ai-2024.excerpt: Image generation AI reduced demand for freelance illustrators by 21% within 12 months of widespread availability.

nber-csuite-survey-2025.title: C-Suite Survey on AI and Employment: Early Evidence
nber-csuite-survey-2025.excerpt: Survey of 2,500 C-suite executives finds 90% report no significant net employment impact from AI adoption as of Q3 2025, though task reallocation is widespread.

nber-entry-wage-2023.title: Artificial Intelligence, Automation and Work
nber-entry-wage-2023.excerpt: Theoretical framework for automation's displacement and productivity effects on labor. Automation displaces workers from tasks they previously performed, but productivity gains create new tasks and increase demand for labor.

nber-freelance-ai-2024.title: The Impact of Generative AI on Freelance Labor Markets
nber-freelance-ai-2024.excerpt: ChatGPT's launch caused a 21% decline in freelance writing job postings and a 15% drop in average hourly rates within 6 months.

nber-spatial-ai-2024.title: The Spatial Distribution of AI's Labor Market Effects
nber-spatial-ai-2024.excerpt: Each AI job in a hub city creates 3-5 local service jobs. Non-hub cities see net job losses. The spatial multiplier amplifies geographic wage divergence.

ncbi-hospital-ai-billing-2024.title: Hospital Trends in the Use, Evaluation, and Governance of Predictive AI, 2023-2024
ncbi-hospital-ai-billing-2024.publisher: NCBI / ASTP Health IT Data Brief
ncbi-hospital-ai-billing-2024.excerpt: Hospital use of AI for billing automation surged from 36% to 61% (+25pp) between 2023 and 2024. Scheduling automation grew from 51% to 67%. Fastest-growing AI use cases in healthcare.

nejm-admin-ai-2024.title: Artificial Intelligence in Healthcare Administration: A Systematic Review
nejm-admin-ai-2024.excerpt: AI medical coding achieves 95% accuracy vs. 90% for human coders. AI-driven scheduling reduces no-show rates by 25%. Administrative cost reduction estimated at 20-35%.

noy-zhang-productivity-2023.title: Experimental Evidence on the Productivity Effects of Generative Artificial Intelligence
noy-zhang-productivity-2023.excerpt: ChatGPT compressed productivity distribution — low-ability workers gained most (40% time reduction, 18% quality increase). May reduce skill premium over time.

noy-zhang-science-2023.title: Experimental Evidence on the Productivity Effects of Generative Artificial Intelligence
noy-zhang-science-2023.excerpt: RCT: ChatGPT reduced task completion time by 40% and raised output quality by 18%. Low-ability workers benefited most, compressing the productivity distribution.

nvidia-10k-2024.title: NVIDIA 2025 Proxy Statement
nvidia-10k-2024.excerpt: NVIDIA median employee total compensation was $301,233 in FY2025 (ending January 2025), with CEO-to-median pay ratio of 166:1. Total headcount reached 36,000, a 21.6% increase YoY.

oecd-2023.title: OECD Employment Outlook 2023: AI and the Labour Market
oecd-2023.excerpt: 27% of jobs are in occupations at high risk of automation across OECD countries.

oecd-education-outlook-2025.title: OECD Education at a Glance 2025: AI and Teaching
oecd-education-outlook-2025.excerpt: Teaching roles are among the least automatable (15% task exposure), but education support staff, administration, and tutoring face 30-40% task displacement.

oecd-employment-2023.title: OECD Employment Outlook 2023: AI and the Labour Market
oecd-employment-2023.excerpt: 27% of jobs are in occupations at high risk, but actual displacement depends on adoption speed and policy response.

oecd-employment-2025.title: OECD Employment Outlook 2025: AI and the Labour Market

oecd-white-collar-2025.title: OECD Employment Outlook 2025: AI and High-Skill Occupations
oecd-white-collar-2025.excerpt: Professional services occupations face the largest task-level AI exposure among high-income economies, with 18-25% of tasks fully automatable by current LLMs.

oecd-youth-employment-2025.title: OECD Youth Employment Outlook 2025
oecd-youth-employment-2025.excerpt: Youth (18-24) employment in OECD countries in AI-exposed sectors declined 4.5% YoY. Real starting salaries fell 3-8% across knowledge-work sectors.

openai-8k-funding-2024.title: OpenAI is paying workers $1.5 million in stock-based compensation on average
openai-8k-funding-2024.excerpt: OpenAI average stock-based compensation reached $1.5M per employee in 2025. Research scientist total compensation ranges from $763K to $1.44M. The company raised $6.6B in October 2024 at a $157B valuation.

papanikolaou-bpea-historical-2025.title: Technology and Labor Markets: Past, Present, and Future; Evidence from Two Centuries of Innovation
papanikolaou-bpea-historical-2025.excerpt: In sharp contrast to the past two centuries, AI will shift relative demand toward occupations with lower education, lower wages, and a greater share of male workers.

papanikolaou-schmidt-ai-labor-2025.title: Artificial Intelligence and the Labor Market
papanikolaou-schmidt-ai-labor-2025.excerpt: Tasks with higher AI exposure subsequently experience reduced labor demand. 1 SD increase in AI exposure reduces relative demand for related skills by 2%.

pearson-10k-2024.title: Pearson plc 2024 Annual Report — AI Strategy
pearson-10k-2024.excerpt: Pearson pivoted to AI-first content delivery, reducing editorial headcount by 18% while growing AI-generated adaptive learning content 300%.

pearson-smarthinking-2025.title: Pearson Retires Smarthinking Human Tutoring Service
pearson-smarthinking-2025.excerpt: Pearson fully retired its Smarthinking human tutoring service, replacing it with AI-powered chatbot tutors. Marks complete displacement of a human tutoring workforce by AI in a major education company.

peng-copilot-2023.title: The Impact of AI on Developer Productivity: Evidence from GitHub Copilot
peng-copilot-2023.excerpt: RCT: developers completed a coding task 55.8% faster with GitHub Copilot assistance.

pnas-nexus-2025.title: AI exposure predicts unemployment risk
pnas-nexus-2025.excerpt: Workers in AI-exposed occupations face significantly higher unemployment risk.

pnas-unemployment-2025.title: AI exposure predicts unemployment risk
pnas-unemployment-2025.excerpt: Workers in AI-exposed occupations face significantly higher unemployment risk, suggesting aggregate job losses may exceed earlier estimates.

pwbm-ai-adoption-2025.title: The Projected Impact of Generative AI on Future Productivity Growth
pwbm-ai-adoption-2025.excerpt: In about 40% of employment in exposed occupations, at least 50% of tasks will be replaceable. Average labor-cost savings ~25% from current tools, potentially 40% as systems improve.

pwbm-ai-productivity-2025.title: The Projected Impact of Generative AI on Future Productivity Growth
pwbm-ai-productivity-2025.excerpt: Roughly 10% of US work affected in the short run; AI will increase productivity and GDP by 1.5% by 2035. Jobs that AI can completely replace saw 0.75% employment fall 2021-2024.

pwc-ai-jobs-barometer-2025.title: PwC Global AI Jobs Barometer 2025
pwc-ai-jobs-barometer-2025.excerpt: AI-skilled workers command a 56% wage premium, up from 25% in prior year. AI roles median compensation at $157K vs. $49,500 all-occupation median.

pwc-ai-wage-premium-2025.title: PwC AI Jobs Barometer 2025: The AI Wage Premium
pwc-ai-wage-premium-2025.excerpt: Workers with AI skills now command a 56% wage premium over non-AI peers, up from 25% just one year prior. AI roles median compensation reaches $157K.

queen-mary-turing-freelancer-2025.title: Creative Industries and GenAI (CREAATIF Good Work Report)
queen-mary-turing-freelancer-2025.publisher: Queen Mary University of London / Alan Turing Institute
queen-mary-turing-freelancer-2025.excerpt: Survey of 335 freelance creative workers: 73% believe GenAI is altering quality of work; 68% feel job security reduced; 61% say value placed on their work has decreased; 55% report decline in financial compensation.

ramp-freelance-creative-2025.title: AI Labor Market Impact: Freelancers
ramp-freelance-creative-2025.excerpt: Heaviest pre-ChatGPT freelance spenders shifted to AI tools fastest; substitution ratio of $1 reduced freelance spend to only $0.03 in AI spend.

ramp-freelance-economics-2025.title: Ramp Economics Lab: Freelance Marketplace Spending Collapse
ramp-freelance-economics-2025.excerpt: Business spend on freelance marketplaces fell from 0.66% to 0.14% of total spend. Writer earnings on these platforms dropped ~31% (based on marketplace spending data; other studies find 5-33% declines depending on metric). Over half of businesses stopped using freelancers for AI-automatable tasks.

ramp-freelance-total-2025.title: AI Labor Market Impact: Freelancers
ramp-freelance-total-2025.excerpt: More than half of businesses using freelancers in 2022 have stopped entirely; freelance marketplace spend fell from 0.66% to 0.14% of total business spend.

ramp-freelance-velocity-2025.title: AI Labor Market Impact: Freelancers
ramp-freelance-velocity-2025.excerpt: Freelance marketplace spend fell from 0.66% to 0.14% of total business spend (Q4 2021 to Q3 2025); substitution ratio: $1 reduced freelance spend → $0.03 in AI spend.

rand-edtech-ai-2023.title: Using Artificial Intelligence Tools in K-12 Classrooms
rand-edtech-ai-2023.excerpt: Surveyed 1,020 teachers nationally; 18% of K-12 teachers used AI for teaching with most using adaptive learning systems weekly. 60% of districts planned to train teachers on AI.

reuters-health-admin-cuts.title: Insurers say they'll deploy more AI to combat 'aggressive' coding by hospitals
reuters-health-admin-cuts.excerpt: Health insurance companies deploying AI to combat rising costs driven by hospital use of AI for billing and coding.

revere-health-ai-layoffs-2025.title: Transitions to AI spark mass layoffs at Utah healthcare company
revere-health-ai-layoffs-2025.excerpt: Revere Health eliminated 177 positions (billing, coding, accounts receivable) after partnering with IKS Health for AI-driven claims processing and automated billing. Largest documented healthcare admin AI layoff.

salesforce-10k-ai-2024.title: Salesforce Announces Strong Fourth Quarter Fiscal 2024 Results
salesforce-10k-ai-2024.excerpt: Salesforce Einstein platform serves over 200 billion AI predictions per day across Customer 360 applications. Einstein 1 platform enables AI-powered apps with low-code development and generative AI assistants.

sciencedirect-freelancer-demand-2025.title: The Impact of Generative AI on Freelancer Demand: A Multi-Platform Study
sciencedirect-freelancer-demand-2025.excerpt: Writing gig volume dropped ~30% across major freelance platforms post-ChatGPT. Translation and data entry categories down 35-45%. AI-augmented freelancers partially offset decline.

shopify-earnings-2024.title: Shopify Q4 2024 Earnings — AI Customer Support Metrics
shopify-earnings-2024.excerpt: Shopify reported its AI assistant Sidekick now resolves 40% of merchant support queries without human intervention, up from 12% one year prior.

soa-uk-illustrators-2024.title: Society of Authors UK Survey: Impact of Generative AI on Creative Workers
soa-uk-illustrators-2024.excerpt: 26% of illustrators and 36% of translators have already lost work to generative AI. 78% of illustrators and 77% of translators expect further income decline. Survey of 787 creative professionals.

sp500-layoff-tracker-2025.title: AI was behind over 50,000 layoffs in 2025
sp500-layoff-tracker-2025.excerpt: Challenger, Gray & Christmas reports AI has been cited as the reason for 54,694 planned layoffs in 2025. Overall job cuts topped 1 million in 2025.

stanford-ai-index-2025.title: Stanford AI Index Report 2025
stanford-ai-index-2025.excerpt: 78% of organizations report using AI in at least one business function. Enterprise AI spending grew 45% YoY globally.

stanford-codex-legal-ai.title: AI might not be coming for lawyers' jobs anytime soon
stanford-codex-legal-ai.excerpt: Despite early signs that AI is beginning to affect entry-level workers, labor statistics have yet to show lawyers being displaced. Law graduate employment in 2024 reached 93.4% — the highest rate on record.

stiglitz-korinek-steering-2025.title: Steering Technological Progress
stiglitz-korinek-steering-2025.excerpt: For the empirically plausible case that capital and labor are gross complements, raising wages requires capital-augmenting innovation rather than labor-augmenting.

tdoc-10k-2024.title: Teleperformance: 2024 Annual Results
tdoc-10k-2024.excerpt: Teleperformance reported full-year 2024 revenue of EUR 10,280 million. Plans to invest up to EUR 100 million in AI-focused partnerships during 2025. Over 200 new AI projects launched in 2024.

techcrunch-ai-salary-gap.title: AI is driving mass layoffs in tech, but it's boosting salaries by $18,000 a year everywhere else, study says
techcrunch-ai-salary-gap.excerpt: Job postings for non-tech roles that require AI skills offer 28% higher salaries — an average of nearly $18,000 more per year. The divide between AI-skilled and non-AI-skilled workers is widening.

techcrunch-creative-layoffs.title: As layoffs deepen, AI's role in the cuts is murky — but it definitely has one
techcrunch-creative-layoffs.excerpt: The advent and uptake of AI is playing some part in the scope of tech layoffs. Companies have signaled sizeable investments in AI to augment or replace work currently done by people.

unctad-creative-industry-2025.title: Creative Economy Outlook 2024
unctad-creative-industry-2025.excerpt: Covers the role of creative industries in trade and economic growth; discusses AI's impact on the creative economy. Creative services exports surged to $1.4 trillion in 2022.

unesco-ai-education-2023.title: Guidance for Generative AI in Education and Research
unesco-ai-education-2023.excerpt: AI tutoring systems can handle 60% of routine student queries. Teaching assistants and tutors face the most immediate displacement risk.

unitedhealth-10k-2024.title: From claims to care: How AI could give health care its fast track
unitedhealth-10k-2024.excerpt: UnitedHealth deployed over 1,000 AI applications across insurance, care delivery, and pharmacy. AI chatbots handled over 65 million customer calls in 2024. Invested $1.5B in AI targeting ~$1B in annual operating cost savings.

uoc-creative-automation-2025.title: AI Can Automate Creative Professions, UOC Study Finds
uoc-creative-automation-2025.excerpt: Peer-reviewed study finds AI can now automate substantial portions of creative work. Freelance writing gigs dropped 30% post-ChatGPT launch.

ups-8k-2024.title: UPS cuts 12,000 jobs, citing softer demand and higher union labor costs
ups-8k-2024.excerpt: UPS announced 12,000 job cuts, primarily management and salaried positions, as part of a $1 billion cost-reduction effort. Full-time driver pay raised to $49/hr top rate under 2023 Teamsters contract.

upwork-earnings-q2-2024.title: Upwork Q2 2024 Earnings Report
upwork-earnings-q2-2024.excerpt: Gross services volume in writing declined 33% YoY. Translation down 40%. Company pivoting to AI-augmented freelancer model.

upwork-freelancer-impact.title: Upwork Q2 2024 Earnings — Freelancer Market Trends
upwork-freelancer-impact.excerpt: Writing and translation freelancer job volume declined ~30% YoY. Graphic design jobs fell 17%. AI-augmented creative roles grew 45%.

upwork-trends-2023.title: Upwork Freelance Forward 2023
upwork-trends-2023.excerpt: Writing freelancers reported 15% fewer job postings; early signs of rate compression in translation and content categories.

walmart-10k-2024.title: Walmart Lowers Starting Pay for New Hires
walmart-10k-2024.excerpt: Walmart's minimum starting wage is $14/hr while average U.S. associate wage reached $18.25 by 2025. The company invested in checkout and inventory automation but has not disclosed specific per-location staffing reduction figures.

webb-2024.title: The Impact of Artificial Intelligence on the Labor Market
webb-2024.excerpt: AI exposure is concentrated among high-skill, high-wage occupations, but wage effects may cascade downward.

wef-creative-2023.title: Future of Jobs Report 2023 — Creative and Media Professions
wef-creative-2023.excerpt: Graphic designers, copywriters, and marketing analysts are among the roles employers expect to decline most rapidly due to generative AI.

wef-education-displacement-2025.title: Future of Jobs Report 2025: Education Sector Analysis
wef-education-displacement-2025.excerpt: Education support roles face moderate displacement risk while core teaching remains protected. Administrative and content creation roles most affected by AI adoption.

wef-future-jobs-2023.title: Future of Jobs Report 2023
wef-future-jobs-2023.excerpt: Employers estimate that 44% of workers' core skills will be disrupted in the next five years.

wef-future-jobs-2024.title: Future of Jobs Report 2024
wef-future-jobs-2024.excerpt: Employers expect 23% of jobs to change in the next five years, with a net decline of 2-4% of total roles once job creation offsets displacement.

wef-future-jobs-2025.title: Future of Jobs Report 2025
wef-future-jobs-2025.excerpt: 40% of employers globally expect to reduce headcount as AI automates tasks. Net displacement estimates range from 5-14% of current roles by 2030.

worldbank-liu-wang-yu-2025.title: Labor Demand in the Age of Generative AI: Early Evidence from the U.S. Job Posting Data
worldbank-liu-wang-yu-2025.excerpt: Job postings for high-AI-substitution occupations fell 12% relative to low-substitution roles post-ChatGPT; effect grew from 6% in year one to 18% by year three. Based on 285 million Lightcast job postings.

wsj-automation-2024.title: AI Is Starting to Threaten White-Collar Jobs

wsj-entry-level-squeeze.title: Entry-Level Jobs Are Vanishing — and AI Is a Big Reason

wsj-white-collar-layoffs.title: White-Collar Workers Are Starting to Feel the AI Squeeze

x-ai-salaries-thread.title: AI engineer salaries are insane right now

yale-budget-lab-2025.title: AI and the U.S. Labor Market: No Macro Displacement Yet
yale-budget-lab-2025.excerpt: Analysis finds no significant macro-level job displacement from AI as of late 2025, though structural shifts are emerging in specific sectors.

zendesk-ai-cs-2026.title: Zendesk AI Customer Service Statistics 2026
zendesk-ai-cs-2026.excerpt: 95% of customer interactions projected to be AI-powered by 2028. Current AI resolution rates at leading companies exceed 55% without human escalation.

althoff-reichardt-task-specific-technica.title: Task-Specific Technical Change and Comparative Advantage
